title: IPL 2026 Auction: 3 Sri Lankans among top INR 2 Crore picks
byline: Matheesha Pathirana, Maheesh Theekshana, and Wanindu Hasaranga are among 46 players entering the 2026 IPL auction at the maximum base price of INR 2 crore. The long list of 1,355 registered cricketers was shared with franchises on Monday following the November 30 registration deadline.

title: Ireland name squad for ICC Men’s Under-19 World Cup
byline: Olly Riley will lead the squad as Reuben Wilson is set to make his third appearance in the marquee event.

title: No more cyclonic storm, but rain will continue: Met. Department
byline: Sri Lanka will continue to experience showers this month as the Northeast Monsoon remains activated, an official from the Department of Meteorology said yesterday.

title: Coast Guard ship Huravee offers disaster relief supportin Sri Lanka
byline: The Maldives National Defense Force (MNDF) Coast Guard ship Huravee has made its first official visit to Sri Lanka, joining the country’s 75th Navy anniversary celebrations and offering readiness to provide humanitarian and disaster relief support amid ongoing floods.

title: Cyclone Ditwah Sri Lanka Live Updates – Death Toll, Floods, Landslides, International Aid and Government Alerts
byline: Sri Lanka is now confronting one of its gravest natural disasters in recent memory, as Cyclone Ditwah and the resulting weather system continue to unleash relentless rain, flash floods and landslides across the island.

title: Fallen SLAF pilot posthumously promoted to Group Captain
byline: Wing Commander Nirmal Siyambalapitiya, who lost his life in the recent helicopter crash in Lunuwila, Wennappuwa, has been posthumously promoted to the rank of Group Captain, the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) said.

title: Flight carrying humanitarian assistance arrives from UAE
byline: A flight carrying humanitarian assistance from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) for those affected by the recent disaster situation in Sri Lanka arrived in the country early this morning, President’s Media Division (PMD)said.

title: Putin extends condolences to Sri Lankan President
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin has extended his condolences to Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake following the recent floods and landslides that have caused significant loss of life and widespread destruction across the island nation.

title: Duty free mechanism introduced for overseas disaster relief donations
byline: The Government has introduced a more convenient procedure to expedite the clearance and distribution of all material aid sent to the country, free of all tariffs and charges.

title: Resettle flood affected people in safe areas: Cardinal
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith urged authorities to resettle flood affected people in safe areas which do not go under water.

title: WHO warning over shortage of obesity jabs
byline: Fewer than one in 10 people who could benefit from obesity jabs like Wegovy are able to get them, warns the World Health Organization as it releases its first guidance on the drugs.

title: Kelani River water levels receding
byline: The Irrigation Department announced that water levels in the Kelani River are continuing to recede.

title: Death toll rises to 410, over 500 houses fully destroyed
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported that the death toll from the ongoing disaster situation impacting all 25 districts has risen to 410.

title: No changes in school reopening date, situation to be reviewed
byline: The Ministry of Education announced that schools are scheduled to reopen on December 16, and that the decision remains unchanged as of now.

title: C.B. Rathnayake appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today (02)

title: Army launches special operation to clear main access road to Sri Pada
byline: A special operation is underway to restore the main entrance road leading to the Sri Pada site, after adverse weather conditions caused blockages and disruptions along the route.

title: Sri Lanka at risk of post-flood disease outbreak
byline: As floodwaters begin to recede across affected areas, health experts are raising alarm over a spike in waterborne diseases, which spread through contaminated water.

title: Maldives Police donate MVR 2.4M for Sri Lanka cyclone relief
byline: The Maldives Police Service has donated MVR 2.4 million to the “Ceylon Aa Eku Dhivehin” telethon, organised to support Sri Lankan communities affected by the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Over 1.3 million affected by adverse weather across 25 districts
byline: A total of 1,373,899 individuals from 382,651 families across 25 districts have been affected by the ongoing adverse weather conditions, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: King Charles ‘deeply saddened’ over ‘terrible’ floods in South and Southeast Asia
byline: In a new statement, King Charles has addressed the “terrible” floods across South and Southeast Asia.

title: Ad hoc food donations lead to wastage while the needy remain unattended
byline: Several pictures circulating on social media and complaints from locals residing in flood-affected areas reveal that food distributions by independent donors have been conducted in an ad hoc manner, without assessing the situation or determining the exact number of people who require food.

title: Massive price hike for vegetables — Current prices by some vendors
byline: Vegetable prices in Sri Lanka have surged dramatically after the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah destroyed crops. With supply down, local vendors have been forced to raise prices sharply.

title: Chilaw Hospital OPD to reopen
byline: The Outpatients’ Department (OPD) of the Chilaw District General Hospital, which was temporarily closed due to adverse weather conditions, will reopen to the public tomorrow (03), hospital authorities said.

title: Over 275,000 children affected in Sri Lanka following Cyclone: UNICEF
byline: UNICEF Sri Lanka has warned that more than 275,000 children have been affected by the devastating Cyclone Ditwah, which struck the East Coast on 28 November.

title: Pakistan men’s cricket team to tour Sri Lanka for T20I series
byline: The Pakistan national men’s cricket team is set to tour Sri Lanka in January 2026 for a three-match T20 International series, Sri Lanka Cricket has confirmed.

title: A/L exam to resume in early January
byline: The Education Ministry has decided to conduct the rest of the GCE Advanced Level examination in early January 2026, Ministry Secretary Nalaka Kaluwewa said.

title: CEB assures no power cuts over unpaid bills in disaster-hit areas
byline: Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) General Manager Shirley Kumara said that electricity supply to households in disaster-affected areas will not be disconnected.

title: Pakistan says aid aircraft still stranded without adequate overflight clearance
byline: Pakistan has claimed that its relief aircraft remains stranded due to insufficient overflight clearance, despite India stating earlier that permission had been granted for a Pakistani plane carrying humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka.

title: Government’s failure to avert recent floods is violation of Constitution: UNP
byline: The failure to act by the President, Prime Minister and the Cabinet to avert the recent floods is a violation of the Constitution which guarantees the right to life of the people, a statement issued by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and leader of the United National Party (UNP) said today.

title: Bribery Commission arrests former Minister C. B. Ratnayake
byline: Former Minister C. B. Ratnayake has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Dawoodi Bohra Community donates Rs. 10 Million to support cyclone Ditwah relief
byline: The Dawoodi Bohra community in Sri Lanka has mobilised and extended its support to the national response for Cyclone Ditwah, contributing Rs. 10 million to the President’s Relief Fund.

title: Samsung unveils first multi-folding phone as competition set to heat up
byline: Samsung Electronics (005930.KS), opens new tab unveiled on Tuesday its first multi-folding smartphone, in a bid to strengthen its position in a sector of the phone market where competition is expected to intensify.

title: Police urge organised relief as congestion hampers disaster operations
byline: Police have warned that the arrival of numerous relief teams and heavy vehicles is slowing road‑clearing and recovery efforts in disaster‑affected areas.

title: Official death toll figures due to floods far from accurate: UNP
byline: Official figures of the recent flood disaster are far from being accurate, as some deaths have not been accounted for, a key opposition figure said today.

title: Donations via DMC to be exempted from tax: Customs DG
byline: Sri Lanka Customs Director General Seevali Arukgoda announced that donations from abroad will be exempted from taxes and released promptly, provided they are sent in coordination with the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) and clearly labelled as disaster relief.

title: Court of Appeal fixes order on BYD intervention petition for December 10
byline: The Court of Appeal today re-fixed for December 10 the delivery of its order on the intervention petition filed by a Vehicle Importers Association, which is seeking permission to intervene in the writ petitions filed by John Keells CG Auto (Pvt) Ltd, the authorised distributor of BYD vehicles in Sri Lanka.

title: CSE sees broad-based recovery after recent losses
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange witnessed a strong recovery on Tuesday (02nd December 2025), as the ASPI rebounded by 219.51 points (+1.00%) to close at 22,241.57, following yesterday’s panic-induced sell-off.

title: IOC president calls for end to 'finger-pointing' in doping fight
byline: International Olympic Committee president Kirsty Coventry and her World Anti-Doping Agency counterpart on Tuesday called for unity in the fight against performance-enhancing drugs following a fracture with the United States.

title: Fifa set to use VAR for corners at World Cup
byline: Fifa is set to press ahead with plans to have VAR checks on the awarding of corner kicks at the 2026 World Cup despite domestic leagues rejecting the idea for the wider game.

title: India rejects Pakistan’s claim of delayed clearance for SL relief flight
byline: India rejected Pakistan’s accusation that New Delhi had delayed granting overflight clearance for a Pakistani aircraft carrying humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka, calling the allegation “ridiculous” and “misinformation.”

title: Port City Colombo extends Rs. 10Mn, on-ground support for Cyclone Ditwah relief
byline: CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd. has donated Rs. 10 million to the Government’s newly established ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund and has mobilised on-ground assistance to support recovery efforts, following one of the most devastating natural disasters to hit the country.

title: Rainfall expected to increase from Thursday
byline: The Department of Meteorology says the Northeast Monsoon is expected to gradually establish over the island in the coming days, bringing increased rainfall to several regions.

title: Initial grant to restore sanitation, clean houses increased to Rs. 25,000
byline: The Ministry of Finance has approved an increase in the assistance granted for cleaning flood-affected houses and property from Rs. 10,000 to Rs. 25,000.

title: UAE’s second batch of humanitarian aid arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The second batch of humanitarian aid donated by the United Arab Emirates (UAE) arrived in Sri Lanka this afternoon to support communities severely affected by the recent disaster, President’s Media Division (PMD)said.

title: Parliament website re-launched; people can now engage directly with MPs
byline: People are now able to engage directly with the MPs through the new Parliament website, which was inaugurated by Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne recently.

title: Over 150 water supply systems hit by islandwide adverse weather: NWSDB
byline: The adverse weather conditions affecting the island have severely disrupted water supply operations across multiple districts, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) said.

title: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake remanded
byline: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption over an offence said to have been committed under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, was remanded till December 16 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: CMC suspends parking fees until Dec. 5
byline: The Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) said that parking fees within Colombo city limits will be temporarily suspended to assist residents affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Ex-England player arrested on suspicion of attempted rape
byline: A former England and Premier League footballer has been arrested on suspicion of attempted rape.

title: Salah a top professional after being dropped - Slot
byline: Liverpool manager Arne Slot described forward Mohamed Salah as a ’’top professional’’ for his response to being dropped.

title: Former England batter Robin Smith dies aged 62
byline: Nicknamed ’Judge’, Smith played 62 Tests between 1988 and 1996, scoring 4,236 runs at an average 43.67, including nine centuries.

title: Dambulla to Host Sri Lanka–Pakistan T20 Clash in January
byline: Sri Lanka will host a three-match T20 series against Pakistan in January, the cricket board announced on Tuesday.
